description:
Dear ElasticSearchers,

Our local ElasticSearch User Group BeLux has quickly grown to 43 members, including creator Shay Banon (who couldn't make it to this edition).

We 'sold out' so fast, that we booked a slightly larger room at the same location. We are now able to host up to 25 ElasticSearchers. Those who arrive late, might have to stand in the back. Another good reason to be on time :) 

Feel free to use this Meetup board to share carpool requests and other transport arrangements (metro station Pétillion is a 3 minute walk).

When: Tuesday, June 11,[masked]:00 PM

Where: ICAB Businesrs & Technology Incubator
Witte Patersstraat 4  (Dutch)

4 Rue des Pères Blancs (French)
1040 Brussels

Program of our first Meetup:

19h00 Get your badge & secure a front row seat. 19h15 Quick intro & pizza order for the hungry. 19h20 Engagor.com CTO Jurriaan Perseyn will give an introduction about ElasticSearch. 20h00 Pizza time and round table during which each participants quickly presents him/herself and has the opportunity to explain a personal ElasticSearch goal or problem. For those without issues, this is the moment to share your "Lessons Learned". Feel free to bring your supporting slides or demo. 20h45 We'll pick one or two ElasticSearch challenges from the pizza round to dive into during this collaborative expert session. 21h30 Closing with some beers, during which you're invited to suggest hands-on workshops or your own presentation for next edition. The room & drinks are kindly paid by our sponsors (Data.be, Engagor.com and KnowledgePlaza.net).

We'll order food at 19h30 and expect you to bring some pizza cash in case you're hungry.

We took the liberty to twist the official ElasticSearch logo for our Belux user group, since it is well known fact that Manneken Pis helps Bonsai to grow :)

Looking forward to meet you, exchange information & learn new tricks.

Kind regards from your organizers,

Sandy, Eric & Toon (GSM group profile on Meetup.

venue.name: ICAB Business & Technology Incubator
venue.address_1: Witte Patersstraat 4 rue de Peres Blancs

how_to_find_us: Use the entrance at the back of the building. Call +32 479 27 29 29 if the door is closed or text 'Ring Ring' if you're late...
name: Introduction to ElasticSearch and sharing lessons learned by developers

description:
Belgian based ES veteran Christoph Evers will give an introduction on how to easily install ElasticSearch. After the installation Christoph will cover 'Mapping Strategies' and different approaches to analyze your data set.

Christoph will provide some  examples and is open to your suggestions/cases for mapping and analyzing in the second part of the evening.

venue.name: ICAB Business & Technology Incubator
venue.address_1: Witte Patersstraat 4 rue de Peres Blancs

name: Back to School: ElasticSearch installation class covering mapping & analyzing

description:
This is a last-minute get together, because Elasticsearch core developer Luca Cavanna will be working in Brussels and kindly suggested to share "What's New in Percolator" and some interesting use cases.

Luca will talk about the new distributed version of percolator, a major part of the forthcoming 1.0 release. Luca will explain why the current version needed to be rearchitected and go into some detail on the percolator implementation. He will also cover some common use cases he's observed for percolator amongst Elasticsearch's customers.


Our second speaker will be <a>Bogdan Dumitrescu</a> (Trifork), with a presentation titled: "Testing the Limits of Elasticsearch". Whenever people start working with Elasticsearch they have to make important configuration decisions. Most of the decisions can be altered along the line (refresh interval, number of replicas), but one stands out as permanent - number of shards. Many developers feel the pressure of making the right choice in regards to the number of shards they will use when creating an index. But with a base line of what the maximum shard size is and knowing how much data needs to be stored in elasticsearch, the choice of number of shards becomes much easier.

Meetup participants that come up with challenging questions or add their own use case will get a surprise gift. There will be Elasticsearch stickers too, to spread Bonsai happiness in the Big Data universe.


In a nice gesture to help gender balance our meetup, Elasticsearch throws in some limited edition ladies cut t-shirts. "Elastic ladies" whom attend will get priority, but gentlemen that fancy ladies cut tees and want to out their love for Elasticsearch will not be excluded :)

venue.name: ICAB Business & Technology Incubator
venue.address_1: Witte Patersstraat 4 rue de Peres Blancs

how_to_find_us: Same "AZZAR" room as last meetup. If the front door is closed, select "Event-elastic" from the menu or SMS/TEXT +32479272929: 'Big Data Dong'
name: "What's New in Percolator" by Luca Cavanna & "Testing Limits of Elasticsearch"

description:
We will host 2 tracks to suit the elasticsearch needs of beginners and experts during this meetup:
Track 1: A beginners guide to Bonsai pruning
Track 2: Brew your own eslaticsearch percolator in under 2 hours

Bring your laptops and an open mind.
Track leaders will provide virtual machines
Oh, we're are looking for track leaders... so feel to jump in.

Let us know in the comments if you want this meetup in Brussels, Antwerp or Ghent.

venue.name: ICAB Business & Technology Incubator
venue.address_1: Witte Patersstraat 4 rue de Peres Blancs

name: Hands-on elasticsearch workshop

description:
Thanks to the international hacker magnet power of the nearby Fosdem open source conference, we are able to present an Elasticsearch core developer.

To avoid interference with the conference schedule and to facilitate international travellers , we were obliged to schedule our meetup on a Friday evening...

This open source gathering in Brussels is well timed to reveal "What's New in Elasticsearch 1.0 With a Focus on Aggregations". A presentation on the brand new features will be given by core developer Honza Kral. 

After a short break we'll probably do a general Elasticsearch Q&A, with Honza, his colleague(s) and fellow community members.


Elasticsearch.com has kindly offered to cater our meetup with open pizza and GPL drinks to start the Fosdem weekend in style :)

P.S. We'll update our program as soon as more details on the presentation and v1.0 release date become available.
name: What's New in Elasticsearch v1.0 with Aggregations
